qa_pairs.question: What aspects of San Francisco do you love?
qa_pairs.answer: I love San Francisco for its traditions, food, scenery, architecture, and the community with different cultural neighborhoods like the Castro, the Mission, and Chinatown.
qa_pairs.source_text: I do love San Francisco I love like all the traditions and I love like all the like I love the food too good I love the um just like the scenery in the buildings everything the architecture is really you know yeah Im like adding lots of work both um this is what Im saying I also like really love the community like having different like cultural neighborhoods for example which I know the planning department has been working on like for example um like the Castro with their lgbtq plus Community the um the mission for example and Chinatown 2 which I know its not a cultural neighborhood but still its like a really its like a cultural inkling still and I think thats like a really crucial part of what I love about San Francisco

qa_pairs.question: How do you perceive the equity focus in San Francisco's city departments?
qa_pairs.answer: I've realized how a lot of our city departments and organizations work through an equity-focused lens, uplifting marginalized communities, which isn't talked about enough on a national stage.
qa_pairs.source_text: Ive realized how a lot of our city departments a lot of our immunizations they work through like an equity Focus lens where um it up some marginalized communities and I feel like that isnt talked about like enough like on a national stage or um or in like different states or different cities

qa_pairs.question: What are your future plans regarding living in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I want to pursue higher education far from San Francisco, maybe on the East Coast or SoCal, but I fully intend to come back to San Francisco after my studies.
qa_pairs.source_text: as for what aspirative um Im looking to come back to San Francisco I think its something complicated question um I feel like when anyones asked me if or where I want to pursue higher education Ive always told them that I want to go far like I want to go maybe like East Coast or SoCal and I dont want to stay anywhere too close to the city thats the same like the same time I know like at the back of my head I fully intentionally come back to San Francisco after uh pursuing um higher education and after um studying somewhere over here

qa_pairs.question: Why do you find San Francisco convenient for biking?
qa_pairs.answer: I love San Francisco because of the bike lanes, which make it convenient to go places, unlike many other cities that don't pay much attention to bikers.
qa_pairs.source_text: I love San Francisco because uh the bike Lanes Im a biker so its pretty convenient to go places and I feel like many other cities like theres not much attention to bikers so I said its great for that

qa_pairs.question: What improvements have you noticed in the Outer Mission area?
qa_pairs.answer: In the Outer Mission, there was less attention back then, but now places like Coyoto Park have been renovated and are better maintained, and the Department of Public Works has been doing a great job cleaning up illegal dumping.
qa_pairs.source_text: I agree with Jackie about like the equity plans because like in the outer Mission I feel like there was less attention back then its like when I was really young coyoto Park was renovated from like super sand like it was full of sand so its kind of dangerous to be running around or playing in it but then its been remodeled and then now its being even better maintained so I appreciate like the extra effort being put in like uh the illegal dumping on the streets uh the Department of Public Works has been doing a great job cleaning that up recently

qa_pairs.question: What are your thoughts on the development and gentrification in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I think with SF working to develop more, there's a danger of gentrification, so developers and planners need to be careful not to drive costs too high, which could displace people from their homes.
qa_pairs.source_text: I could share because I think with SF like working to develop more whats dangerous about that is gentrification so Id like to see like uh during the development process uh like people keeping in mind uh gentrification and like how it could increase the cost of a neighborhood so Im not really sure how that works but uh developers and like planners got to be really careful to not drive the costs too high or else people will start getting uh moved out of their homes

qa_pairs.question: What is your vision for the development of underdeveloped areas in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I would love to see more development in areas of our city that historically haven't had much development, which is a major component of the new housing element. This would allow for more affordable homes and help reach our housing goals.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think I would love to see more development on um on areas of our city which historically havent been um havent had much development I know thats a major component of this housing element like the new the newly updated one and I like I vapely remember like a statistic that was brought up in like a recent meeting with like the college interns and I know some of us sat in um on it were like 85 of like the new housing units have been built on like the east or like the central um area of our city so we have like neighborhoods where it remains a single family homes and which um havent been developed much and as a result we we are stuck in a housing crisis I think yeah and see more develop in these areas of our city would allow for more um affordable homes and yeah and I think thatll help a lot with reaching our goal of like um 80 or 88k Im housing um that were trying to reach

qa_pairs.question: What improvements would you like to see in San Francisco's neighborhoods?
qa_pairs.answer: I would love for SF to focus more on making lesser-known neighborhoods like Bay View, Outer Mission, and Portola more mainstream by adding libraries and parklets, which would also attract tourists.
qa_pairs.source_text: I feel like there are so many neighborhoods and so many communities in SF but a lot of times were only focused on the ones that are more like Northern like the marina or maybe North Beach or even Chinatown but I feel like there are so many that Ive forgotten like the ones where we live like the Bay View or the otter Mission orophistication Valley even Portola so I feel like I would love for SF to be moving towards more like making these like communities known also and like kind of like like mainstreaming them more is adding more libraries or adding like better like partlets also I think parklets would be a great addition to all these neighborhoods Im mentioning because I feel like we also have like pretty nice weather around here too and it would be great for like SF particular advantage of that and to like push these communities more to like the tourists that come maybe like maybe they should explore neighborhoods too
